intro: Cyanococcus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plumbagaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, exhibiting a rosette growth habit. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid or salty environments. Cyanococcus angustifolius is often found in dunes and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
